data.content:
Động từ
xả hơi, xì hơi (một quả bóng…)
(nghĩa bóng) làm xẹp (tính kêu căng..)
(kinh tế) giải lạm phát

verb
-flates; -flated; -flating
[+ obj] :to release air or gas from (something, such as a tire or balloon) and make it smaller
deflate the tires
a deflated football
[no obj] :to lose air or gas from inside
The birthday balloons deflated after a few days. - opposite inflate
[+ obj] to make (someone) lose confidence or pride
The harsh criticism left him utterly deflated.
an insult that would deflate their egos
to show that (something) is not important or true
deflate [=defuse] an argument
He has worked to deflate popular myths about investing.
[+ obj] :to cause (prices, costs, etc.) to decrease :to cause (something, such as money or real estate) to lose value
economic polices that could deflate (the value of) the dollar
Deflated prices mean that farmers are getting less for their products.
